verbatim_example: I've been messing around with heroin and bupe since about April - my most recent relapse.
I didn't sleep for a 4 day span, and now sleep on and off an hour at a time. My thinking is still foggy from the Kratom...
I didn't sleep for a 4 day span in the past 2 weeks. I get so easily over-whelmed, and that feeling is really magnified when I stop dosing.
I only sleep hour stints, last week I was up for 4 days straight. Everything bothers me, my place is trashed from not doing crap for months...
I thought the benzo withdrawals kicked in that first week but now that I look back I think it was primarily opiate withdrawals.
The withdrawal was really intense, I was stuck to my apartment for almost the entire 3 weeks.
I am in the thick of wd.
The wrestless legs still won't quit.
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad.
I am scared bc I know I will want to use.
I don't even remember how it's done.
Every year, Ive celebrated by getting as high as possible. Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
This is the only period of sobriety I've had in 10 years.
Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass.
I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day.
I get these random flashes of old feelings that shoot through me for a few seconds-minutes.
I feel like I can remember every second that's passed by.

it hit me like a fuckin sack of bricks... started pouring sweat, plotting and rationalizing all the ways I could get around this security blanket that I've created, giving myself reasons as to why it would be okay,
Yesterday went pretty well other than a few cases of the clammy sweats.
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats. I fuckin hate that feeling.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless.
In a sluggish mental fog at the moment with that weighing on my mind, coupled with little sleep and no energy.
I've now gone five days without
Got lots of benzos just in case.
I have literally zero memory of this happening. But there it is, stamped in my passport. I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way.
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least.

I was in absolutel agony, I literally layed in the shower crying for like 12 hours, every inch of my body hurt, migraines, sweating like a dog even though my condo was 62 degrees, throwing up, I was so tired but couldn't even lay on my bed because the RLS would start up instantly.
I'm going to get totally straight hamstered!
I swear, that game is my first real experience with addiction.

I bought some Kratom, and have some muscle relaxers for the withdrawl I may experience. But, truth be told - my withdrawl isn't anywhere near what I've seen in others. Bone pain and exhaustion is about it.
That phenomenon of craving is so fucking real, and there has never been any doubt that I'm a true-blue addict regarding these pills.

The memory fades as time goes by. I doubt the memories will ever disappear completely, but I liken it to the memories of an ex-girlfriend. They are romantic memories, and when we think about them, we always conveniently fail to also remember the horrible things that we hated about the relationship.

I remember when I was using that if I was honest with myself, the answer was always that I wanted to change things and wanted to stop- but the next thought would be that I needed to make a plan first, and certainly couldn’t start right then, because I wanted to do it ‘right’. And if not that, then it would be some other complete bullshit nonsense excuse that my brain would trick me into believing, thus delaying doing what I knew deep down that I really wanted to do.
I’ll never forget it- constant memories of using and wanting to use.
Im sick of feeling like crap, throwing up, being depressed
I been in the bathroom all day puking and shitting. When i try to eat or drink liquids all i do is puke them back up.
With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals.
"...staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person."
This is my first sober Halloween in 5 years!

I remember getting strung out in a public bathroom on the boardwalk in Huntington Beach, California. I remember thinking to myself that this is really not what I want to be doing for the rest of my life.

Today I've got 90 days. 90 days ago I was sitting in the IOP program at the Betty Ford Center stung out of my mind with twenty dollars in my pocket anxiously waiting for it to be over that day so that my friend and I could go score yet again.
Have almost 15 days clean now and I notice recovery has been getting harder and harder for me the more i relapse.
I'm currently finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs.
I was doing so well, was already through the worst of the WDs. I have no willpower, I only hope that come tomorrow I'll be able to continue with my plan for sobriety in the new year.

I've been desperately trying anything and everything that I think might give me a rush... Masturbating. Weed. Listening to music. Popping insane amounts of gabapentin. They all just leave me wanting more.
I wish. I'm three weeks clean and have found no happiness or clarity in sobriety.
I was feeling extremely depressed, sweating, cold, jittery/RLS, classic mild WDs.
Nodding to hard to pay attention apparently.
I know about the insomnia, and the RLS, and the aches, and the sweats, and the depression, and the anxiety, as this is not my first time being without the drug,
Had real bad nausea last night, wasn't really anywhere near puking just, felt queasy. And I was wide awake until ~6am when I got REAL tired.
Right now my main issue is memory. Things I should definitely remember are not foggy like when on opiates, but more like just absent.
I guess I forgot what getting sick is like?  I used to be good for 1-2 sinus infections throughout the year but those seemed to have gone away while using opiates.

It's like ice picks in my brain. The pain is incredible. Academic eggheads everywhere babbling and tooting about research and papers, studies, students chirping like little birds and my HEAD is like a balloon filled with shards of glass.
My muscles twitch and roll, like someone has attached strings and pulls on them randomly for kicks. Cloudy head and jumpy jittery chicken sizzle muscles,
I got dizzy and nauseous and angry, I felt attacked (which is nuts).
Bye-bye Egghead U, I'm going the hell home to a bath (my back!) and some sleep.
I was hungry today for the first time in ages, really hungry. I ate through half a box of crackers and two apples, some cheese, and I can't stop drinking water.
I sometimes feel strange, detached in a way, like I can't quite believe I quit.
By the time the conversation was over I wanted to be drunk or high, god I was frustrated.
I've been in recovery for years and I can honestly say that the biggest misconception about addiction is that it's something you can just 'get over' or 'snap out of'.
I probably won't celebrate again til 5 years. It just seems pointless at this point to congratulate myself as it has really become a routine.
We never used together but we were both hopeless dope fiends at the same time but never talked.
I was addicted to heroin again after my first stint in rehab got me almost 6 months of sobriety.
This shit takes the withdrawals away but it is almost not even worth it. Sometimes I can do half a bag or 2 bags before I go bat shit insane.
I haven't used since the day but the cravings have been there 24/7.
I kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago and haven’t had the urge to use more than every now and then since
when you feel you need to get out at moments of clarity and joy let it happen to let the Trick know what they have been missing. It doesn't have to be 24hr lockdown after the initial withdrawls.
I remember myself before using and I was fun, outgoing, worked my ass off and people enjoyed being around me.
I can remember countless days choosing to abstain from eating in order to get another pill.
Took the subs for 7 days, still felt a bit strange during that time. Probably the kratom withdrawal under the subs.
I was in brutal pain and going through withdrawals such as the tingling sensations.
I never get withdrawals; I use to but got past the worst of my addiction and now I only use two times a week give or take a day.
I have been for about 6 years everyday.
Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

Starting all over now. Day 3. My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals
My soul was gone. Shooting dope became a urgency as I'd wake up frantically and call everybody trying to find someone to rip off or some way to score.
I spaced out. No thoughts, no ideas, no concerns. Just blank consciousness.
I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days.
I remember endless aching Timeless nights spent sleepless, taking anything to stop the shaking,
I never learned what was taught / A rich red plume of blood and plant / Was all my life, oh sinking sand
I still have drug dreams 3 years later and honestly, I have no thoughts about going back to that life.
Despite being 22 years old I am all out of veins in my arms, hands, feet, sholders, only groin is left but I don’t know where it is.
my eyes are watering like I’m almost crying for no reason so thats fun
I was declared dead, but that narcan, I can’t make up my mind if I’m glad I woke up.
They gave me something to make my adrenaline chill, and that killed almost all symptoms.
The problem tho is that I have had mild withdrawals after that. How is that even possible?
I can’t remember last time I felt so much, like I am listening to music and crying, on dope I would often go around with headphones no music cuz it did not really make me feel much anymore.
It just hit me hard cuz I can’t remember not feeling like this besides when I am on opiates.
I forget the horrors of being an addict and the terrible withdraws that come with quitting?
The only withdraw symptom that's still bad right now is the sleep.
The mental side though has been hitting me very hard. I'm 26 years old and I can't stop thinking about how far behind I am in life.
I made it through withdraws and had 15 days completely sober.
On Monday I’ll be 3 days into WD and will have to go back to work still dopesick
I am not going to go back and accept I made a mistake but did I just put myself back at day one again of withdraws?
I’ve been done the physical withdraws for like a week now

My dealer always told me if I ever wanted to quit he would completely cut me off and I finally gave him the word and he completely cut me off lol. ... These ideas always sound so great when your high as a kite lol but now that I’m in the thick of it I want to shoot myself
Obviously the PAWS just makes it worse buts it’s been a problem my whole life that I have not been able to conquer and has really held me back in life.
today I woke up around the same time and woke up sweaty with chills and hot flashes
what started as a good high became maintenance we lost everything due to missing work due to withdrawals and kept coming back to it
despite losing it all I am glad I can say we don't have to worry about where money will come and trying to get through each day without having to WD
Until one day I just had to leave because I was dope sick
Luckily I've only been using everyday for about 3 weeks, but fuck. I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough. I have to say I don't feel as bad, physically, as I did when coming off oxy.
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.
I haven't been sick in years, at least I haven't felt sick, other than withdrawals, in years.
I look forward to actually remembering my trip and the wedding.
Opiates brought me to the brink of destruction, and I truly thought my addiction was going to kill me.

I think we've all gone to bed super loaded and just kind of nodded all night. But what has weirded me out is I'll wake up after going to bed really high and both my arms are up in the air like a dead dog.
And dream about scoring, or remembering a misplaced gram in my room every night.
While I am currently keeping withdrawals at bay with 10 - 20mg a day of OC (I was pretty steady at 50 - 100mg a day, every day),
I then remember that I have fifty fucking adderalls in my closet. I take one, and I feel no more WD,
I had my last oxy yesterday morning -- then I had about 1mg of sub last night, and I'm 100% dry
Even on a sunny day, I'm shivering, and my nose is draining.
Recently I drove a 2014 Honda accord. All I thought was "damn, I'd love to have that car."
I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.

It's the middle of November and it's 15 degrees Celsius outside right now (60 degrees in American), it's gorgeous but I just feel like I want to grab all of a sudden. Lot harder to shake today than yesterday.
I do smoke weed. Don't have any at the moment and haven't really smoked much in the past few months as weed and H really put me out of commission to the rest of the world.
Unable to keep any food or even water down.

Even now, on day 6 and just barely through the worst of the physical symptoms, my desire to use is still there. My desire to stay clean is also still there and this is why I'm posting about it and why I've been on the phone all morning.
I'm barely 100 hours into my detox but I'm just thinking about last Wednesday around noon, three hours after my last dose...
I'm tripping balls. I've been thankful to have some extra time before the event to continue to work on my shit but I'm also terrified that the life upheaval will be more than I WANT to handle.

I still remember the obsession of not wanting to be a junkie anymore,but couldn't stop! Numerous times I went to detox, got out went to my parents and felt overwhelmed and that fucking depression sunk in that feeling that I was never going to enjoy life again and within a few hours a friend would be meeting me with a shot up the street,
I have been homeless have boosted and done various other things for a daily fix. Detox 7 times, impatient numerous times...etc etc.

We started using together and he was shocked when he had the same shit happening to him. We were hanging out and smoking with our friend one day and brought this up to him and he was like damn guys, you're kicking!
Someone said withdrawing is paying back all the happiness/good feelings you had while you were high lol.
I swear the withdrawals are just as bad if not worse than last time I detoxed even though I was doing significantly less, diff ROA and shorter time period.
I'm at the breaking point. I'm just trying to not let myself leave the house right now.
this morning was the worst so far. Haven't slept still at all, just absolutely miserable and losing my mind.

I was basically sitting on my hands watching the clock minute by minute telling myself not to leave the house. I knew if I left I'd get dope. I was just so miserable, so depressed, complete anhedonia, couldn't even watch a fucking TV show. Nothing could hold my attention and I felt crushing sadness and hopelessness.
I coached him through his kick while I was still in the depths.
When we don't eat healthily our entire bodies pretty much shut down and we both become very tired, irritable, and lack motivation.
I had no control over my movement and couldn't communicate. It was the scariest feeling.
coming off a 3 week heroin binge that started because of my dopesick coming off of oxycodone. i'm expecting to be ready to die in about eight hours
does anyone with experience on heroin withdrawal know how much longer my body will feel like hell?
It was a really good idea. Thinking of coppin again on the weekend for Saturday night because I play a show... but I may hold off a bit longer so my W/D experience isnt as bad.
because for some reason I don't feel a craving for Oxy like I do with Heroin and as long as I do a tiny bit of opiate I can usually endure any remaining w/d symptoms.
I was smoking about .25 of buffed heroin/fent/fent analog daily, and I haven't even got the crazy rib pains, or really anything besides lethargy/sweats/cold chills.
We lay in bed or do things together all day whether we're high or dope sick.
the withdrawal symptoms i get when i wake up in the morning are a bit worse than i'd have from the suboxone, but still not really anything that bad.
Maybe its the withdrawl, maybe I'm just crazy, maybe I don't have what it takes to overcome my issues.
I have some sub's I can take so that should help buy still need to wait another 12 hour before I can take it.
I was in hardcore, white knuckle, cold turkey withdrawal(puking, shitting, cold sweats, can't get comfortable, etc).
The withdrawals are getting pretty bad.13hkwt
I could just stay up all night, every night. And I do. 4/7 are all-nighters, and the "sleep" I get is basically seething/sweating/rolling around.
I've had withdrawal, but what about *second* withdrawal!? (I didn't relapse, just seemed to go away after a few days and come back wtf)
I'm finally over the worst of WD
Plus I'm not going to ruin 8 months of being clean from heroin over a stupid car and someone that is immature and too full of himself too see he can be an issue.
The only thing stopping me from relapsing is my cousin.
five and a half months ain't goin' out like that.
I remember when I had nearly 90 days, I thought I would have to kill myself to make the obsession to shoot dope go away.
He was still pale and sweating but now crying from the pain of precipitated w/d.
I went 9 days straight fucked up basically all day.
I don't know how to tell him to fuck off without being a total bitch.
I've been trying to study but my head just seems like it's stuck in a fog.
When I come down, the mess is still there.
I have 26 days clean. But god I never wake up without thinking about it.
I've tried the whole be friends with them just do different things. Turns out I'm capable of that for about a week, 2 tops, before I'm using again.
I know it's a stupid thing to let fuck me up but ever since it happened I've been freaking out and all I want to do is get loaded.
I remember how much withdrawals suck a little bit too well.
Days one and two were god awful; my whole body hurt
I know I've had some moments where I wonder if something actually even happened. I was arrested and woke up in jail...
I had an absolute moment of clarity and realized that I was going to die if I kept going--I checked myself into rehab the next day and never looked back.
This week my mom found a bunch of rigs (thankfully she didn't find my stash) and we decided I should go to inpatient again.
I remember how hard it was in the beginning and failing multiple times.
I currently take 20mg opana and 120mg oxycodone daily.
before the dope sickness kicked in
